text: hello everyone it's almost Mother's Day
so today we're going to be making a
handprint tile for you to give to your
mommy as a person to make this tile you
will need flour salt water acrylic paint
fridge magnet letters a rolling pin some
baking paper and some scissors
let's mini make so I'm gonna put a cup
of flour 1/2 a cup of salt and 1/2 a cup
of water into my mixing bowl and then
get my hands nice and dirty oh there we
go so just mix this around and if you
feel like it's too sticky just add a
little bit more flour and if you feel
like it's not sticking together enough
then just add a little bit more water
[Music]
when you can start to be able to round
it in a ball just give it a few more
squishes just so that it's nice and soft
and smooth as well don't want any big
lumps of flour nice if you take a bit of
baking paper pop your dough on top of it
and then get a rolling pin you might
want to pop a little bit of flour on the
rolling pin just to make sure the dough
doesn't stick and then roll it out nice
and squishy and you want to make it so
that it's why didn't have to fit your
handprint and put your name in but you
don't want to make it too thin because
otherwise it won't hold together when
you bake it let's roll out okay so
that's looking good now and then push

and then carefully lift apart there we

it's all top of the eye there we go

you can put them any way you want so it

out Oh lovely ah okay that's looking

round circle so I'll just leave it as it
is and then you can pop it in the oven
at 120 degrees until it's firm and dry
but obviously you need to get a grown-up
to help you with that or you can leave
it to air dry for a few days once it
comes out of the oven look something
like this and then it's ready to paint
so I've chosen orange and red paint for
mine because they're my mum's favorite
colours you can just start painting
straight away these are acrylic paints
and you need to use those because
they're the only ones that'll paint on
